00083 
00084 // an accessor to permit friend access to archives.  Needed because
00085 // some compilers don't handle friend templates completely
00086 class save_access {
00087 public:
00088     template<class Archive>
00089     static void end_preamble(Archive & ar){
00090         ar.end_preamble();
00091     }
00092     template<class Archive, class T>
00093     static void save_primitive(Archive & ar, const  T & t){
00094         ar.end_preamble();
00095         ar.save(t);
00096     }
00097 };
00098 
00099 namespace detail {
00100 
00101 template<class Archive, class T>
00102 class oserializer : public basic_oserializer
00103 {
00104 private:
00105     // private constructor to inhibit any existence other than the 
00106     // static one
00107 public:
00108     explicit BOOST_DLLEXPORT oserializer() :
00109         basic_oserializer(
00110             boost::serialization::type_info_implementation<T>::type
00111                 ::get_const_instance()
00112         )
00113     {}
00114     virtual BOOST_DLLEXPORT void save_object_data(
00115         basic_oarchive & ar,    
00116         const void *x
00117     ) const BOOST_USED;
00118     virtual bool class_info() const {
00119         return boost::serialization::implementation_level<T>::value 
00120             >= boost::serialization::object_class_info;
00121     }
00122     virtual bool tracking(const unsigned int /* flags */) const {
00123         return boost::serialization::tracking_level<T>::value == boost::serialization::track_always
00124             || (boost::serialization::tracking_level<T>::value == boost::serialization::track_selectively
00125                 && serialized_as_pointer());
00126     }
00127     virtual unsigned int version() const {
00128         return ::boost::serialization::version<T>::value;
00129     }
00130     virtual bool is_polymorphic() const {
00131         return boost::is_polymorphic<T>::value;
00132     }
00133     virtual ~oserializer(){}
00134 };
00135 
00136 template<class Archive, class T>
00137 BOOST_DLLEXPORT void oserializer<Archive, T>::save_object_data(
00138     basic_oarchive & ar,    
00139     const void *x
00140 ) const {
00141     // make sure call is routed through the highest interface that might
00142     // be specialized by the user.
00143     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(boost::is_const<T>::value == false);
00144     boost::serialization::serialize_adl(
00145         boost::serialization::smart_cast_reference<Archive &>(ar),
00146         * static_cast<T *>(const_cast<void *>(x)),
00147         version()
00148     );
00149 }
00150 
00151 template<class Archive, class T>
00152 class pointer_oserializer
00153   : public archive_pointer_oserializer<Archive>
00154 {
00155     const basic_oserializer & get_basic_serializer() const;
00156 private:
00157     virtual BOOST_DLLEXPORT void save_object_ptr(
00158         basic_oarchive & ar,
00159         const void * x
00160     ) const BOOST_USED;
00161 public:
00162     explicit BOOST_DLLEXPORT pointer_oserializer() BOOST_USED;
00163 };
00164 
00165 template<class Archive, class T>
00166 const basic_oserializer & 
00167 pointer_oserializer<Archive, T>::get_basic_serializer() const {
00168     return boost::serialization::singleton<
00169         oserializer<Archive, T>
00170     >::get_const_instance();
00171 }
00172 
00173 template<class Archive, class T>
00174 BOOST_DLLEXPORT void pointer_oserializer<Archive, T>::save_object_ptr(
00175     basic_oarchive & ar,
00176     const void * x
00177 ) const {
00178     assert(NULL != x);
00179     // make sure call is routed through the highest interface that might
00180     // be specialized by the user.
00181     T * t = static_cast<T *>(const_cast<void *>(x));
00182     const unsigned int file_version = boost::serialization::version<T>::value;
00183     Archive & ar_impl 
00184         = boost::serialization::smart_cast_reference<Archive &>(ar);
00185     boost::serialization::save_construct_data_adl<Archive, T>(
00186         ar_impl, 
00187         t, 
00188         file_version
00189     );
00190     ar_impl << boost::serialization::make_nvp(NULL, * t);
00191 }
00192 
00193 template<class Archive, class T>
00194 BOOST_DLLEXPORT pointer_oserializer<Archive, T>::pointer_oserializer() :
00195     archive_pointer_oserializer<Archive>(
00196         boost::serialization::type_info_implementation<T>::type
00197             ::get_const_instance()
00198     )
00199 {
00200     // make sure appropriate member function is instantiated
00201     boost::serialization::singleton<
00202         oserializer<Archive, T> 
00203     >::get_mutable_instance().set_bpos(this);
00204 }
00205 
00206 template<class Archive, class T>
00207 struct save_non_pointer_type {
00208     // note this bounces the call right back to the archive
00209     // with no runtime overhead
00210     struct save_primitive {
00211         static void invoke(Archive & ar, const T & t){
00212             save_access::save_primitive(ar, t);
00213         }
00214     };
00215     // same as above but passes through serialization
00216     struct save_only {
00217         static void invoke(Archive & ar, const T & t){
00218             // make sure call is routed through the highest interface that might
00219             // be specialized by the user.
00220             boost::serialization::serialize_adl(
00221                 ar, 
00222                 const_cast<T &>(t), 
00223                 ::boost::serialization::version<T>::value
00224             );
00225         }
00226     };
00227     // adds class information to the archive. This includes
00228     // serialization level and class version
00229     struct save_standard {
00230         static void invoke(Archive &ar, const T & t){
00231             ar.save_object(
00232                 & t, 
00233                 boost::serialization::singleton<
00234                     oserializer<Archive, T>
00235                 >::get_const_instance()
00236             );
00237         }
00238     };
00239 
00240     // adds class information to the archive. This includes
00241     // serialization level and class version
00242     struct save_conditional {
00243         static void invoke(Archive &ar, const T &t){
00244             //if(0 == (ar.get_flags() & no_tracking))
00245                 save_standard::invoke(ar, t);
00246             //else
00247             //   save_only::invoke(ar, t);
00248         }
00249     };
00250 
00251     typedef 
00252         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::eval_if<
00253         // if its primitive
00254             mpl::equal_to<
00255                 boost::serialization::implementation_level<T>,
00256                 mpl::int_<boost::serialization::primitive_type>
00257             >,
00258             mpl::identity<save_primitive>,
00259         // else
00260         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::eval_if<
00261             // class info / version
00262             mpl::greater_equal<
00263                 boost::serialization::implementation_level<T>,
00264                 mpl::int_<boost::serialization::object_class_info>
00265             >,
00266             // do standard save
00267             mpl::identity<save_standard>,
00268         // else
00269         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::eval_if<
00270                 // no tracking
00271             mpl::equal_to<
00272                 boost::serialization::tracking_level<T>,
00273                 mpl::int_<boost::serialization::track_never>
00274             >,
00275             // do a fast save
00276             mpl::identity<save_only>,
00277         // else
00278             // do a fast save only tracking is turned off
00279             mpl::identity<save_conditional>
00280         > > >::type typex; 
00281 
00282     static void invoke(Archive & ar, const T & t){
00283         // check that we're not trying to serialize something that
00284         // has been marked not to be serialized.  If this your program
00285         // traps here, you've tried to serialize a class whose trait
00286         // has been marked "non-serializable". Either reset the trait
00287         // (see level.hpp) or change program not to serialize items of this class
00288         BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT((
00289             mpl::greater_equal<
00290                 boost::serialization::implementation_level<T>, 
00291                 mpl::int_<boost::serialization::primitive_type>
00292             >::value
00293         ));
00294         typex::invoke(ar, t);
00295     };
00296 };
00297 
00298 template<class Archive, class TPtr>
00299 struct save_pointer_type {
00300     template<class T>
00301     struct abstract
00302     {
00303         static const basic_pointer_oserializer * register_type(Archive & /* ar */){
00304             // it has? to be polymorphic
00305             BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(boost::is_polymorphic<T>::value);
00306             return NULL;
00307         }
00308     };
00309 
00310     template<class T>
00311     struct non_abstract
00312     {
00313         static const basic_pointer_oserializer * register_type(Archive & ar){
00314             return ar.register_type(static_cast<T *>(NULL));
00315         }
00316     };
00317 
00318     template<class T>
00319     static const basic_pointer_oserializer * register_type(Archive &ar, T & /*t*/){
00320         // there should never be any need to save an abstract polymorphic 
00321         // class pointer.  Inhibiting code generation for this
00322         // permits abstract base classes to be used - note: exception
00323         // virtual serialize functions used for plug-ins
00324         typedef 
00325             BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::eval_if<
00326                 boost::serialization::is_abstract<T>,
00327                 mpl::identity<abstract<T> >,
00328                 mpl::identity<non_abstract<T> >       
00329             >::type typex;
00330         return typex::register_type(ar);
00331     }
00332 
00333     template<class T>
00334     struct non_polymorphic
00335     {
00336         static void save(
00337             Archive &ar, 
00338             T & t
00339         ){
00340             const basic_pointer_oserializer & bpos = 
00341                 boost::serialization::singleton<
00342                     pointer_oserializer<Archive, T>
00343                 >::get_const_instance();
00344             // save the requested pointer type
00345             ar.save_pointer(& t, & bpos);
00346         }
00347     };
00348 
00349     template<class T>
00350     struct polymorphic
00351     {
00352         static void save(
00353             Archive &ar, 
00354             T & t
00355         ){
00356             BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME 
00357             boost::serialization::type_info_implementation<T>::type const
00358             & i = boost::serialization::type_info_implementation<T>::type
00359                     ::get_const_instance();
00360 
00361             boost::serialization::extended_type_info const * const this_type = & i;
00362 
00363             // retrieve the true type of the object pointed to
00364             // if this assertion fails its an error in this library
00365             assert(NULL != this_type);
00366 
00367             const boost::serialization::extended_type_info * true_type =
00368                 i.get_derived_extended_type_info(t);
00369 
00370             // note:if this exception is thrown, be sure that derived pointer
00371             // is either registered or exported.
00372             if(NULL == true_type){
00373                 boost::serialization::throw_exception(
00374                     archive_exception(archive_exception::unregistered_class)
00375                 );
00376             }
00377 
00378             // if its not a pointer to a more derived type
00379             const void *vp = static_cast<const void *>(&t);
00380             if(*this_type == *true_type){
00381                 const basic_pointer_oserializer * bpos = register_type(ar, t);
00382                 ar.save_pointer(vp, bpos);
00383                 return;
00384             }
00385             // convert pointer to more derived type. if this is thrown
00386             // it means that the base/derived relationship hasn't be registered
00387             vp = serialization::void_downcast(
00388                 *true_type, 
00389                 *this_type, 
00390                 static_cast<const void *>(&t)
00391             );
00392             if(NULL == vp){
00393                 boost::serialization::throw_exception(
00394                     archive_exception(archive_exception::unregistered_cast)
00395                 );
00396             }
00397 
00398             // since true_type is valid, and this only gets made if the 
00399             // pointer oserializer object has been created, this should never
00400             // fail
00401             const basic_pointer_oserializer * bpos 
00402                 = archive_pointer_oserializer<Archive>::find(* true_type);
00403             assert(NULL != bpos);
00404             if(NULL == bpos)
00405                 boost::serialization::throw_exception(
00406                     archive_exception(archive_exception::unregistered_class)
00407                 );
00408             ar.save_pointer(vp, bpos);
00409         }
00410     };
00411 
00412     // out of line selector works around borland quirk
00413     template<class T>
00414     struct conditional {
00415         typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::eval_if<
00416             is_polymorphic<T>,
00417             mpl::identity<polymorphic<T> >,
00418             mpl::identity<non_polymorphic<T> >
00419         >::type type;
00420     };
00421 
00422     // used to convert TPtr in to a pointer to a T
00423     template<class T>
00424     static void save(
00425         Archive & ar, 
00426         const T & t
00427     ){
00428         conditional<T>::type::save(ar, const_cast<T &>(t));
00429     }
00430 
00431     template<class T>
00432     static void const_check(T & t){
00433         BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(! boost::is_const<T>::value);
00434     }
00435 
00436     static void invoke(Archive &ar, const TPtr t){
00437         #ifdef BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_PARTIAL_SPECIALIZATION
00438             // if your program traps here, its because you tried to do
00439             // something like ar << t where t is a pointer to a const value
00440             // void f3(A const* a, text_oarchive& oa)
00441             // {
00442             //     oa << a;
00443             // }
00444             // with a compiler which doesn't support remove_const
00445             // const_check(* t);
00446         #else
00447             // otherwise remove the const
00448         #endif
00449         register_type(ar, * t);
00450         if(NULL == t){
00451             basic_oarchive & boa 
00452                 = boost::serialization::smart_cast_reference<basic_oarchive &>(ar);
00453             boa.save_null_pointer();
00454             save_access::end_preamble(ar);
00455             return;
00456         }
00457         save(ar, * t);
00458     };
00459 };
00460 
00461 template<class Archive, class T>
00462 struct save_enum_type
00463 {
00464     static void invoke(Archive &ar, const T &t){
00465         // convert enum to integers on save
00466         const int i = static_cast<int>(t);
00467         ar << boost::serialization::make_nvp(NULL, i);
00468     }
00469 };
00470 
00471 template<class Archive, class T>
00472 struct save_array_type
00473 {
00474     static void invoke(Archive &ar, const T &t){
00475         typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME boost::remove_extent<T>::type value_type;
00476         
00477         save_access::end_preamble(ar);
00478         // consider alignment
00479         int count = sizeof(t) / (
00480             static_cast<const char *>(static_cast<const void *>(&t[1])) 
00481             - static_cast<const char *>(static_cast<const void *>(&t[0]))
00482         );
00483         ar << BOOST_SERIALIZATION_NVP(count);
00484         ar << serialization::make_array(static_cast<value_type const*>(&t[0]),count);
00485     }
00486 };
00487 
00488 } // detail
00489 
00490 template<class Archive, class T>
00491 inline void save(Archive & ar, const T &t){
00492     typedef 
00493         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::eval_if<is_pointer<T>,
00494             mpl::identity<detail::save_pointer_type<Archive, T> >,
00495         //else
00496         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::eval_if<is_enum<T>,
00497             mpl::identity<detail::save_enum_type<Archive, T> >,
00498         //else
00499         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::eval_if<is_array<T>,
00500             mpl::identity<detail::save_array_type<Archive, T> >,
00501         //else
00502             mpl::identity<detail::save_non_pointer_type<Archive, T> >
00503         >
00504         >
00505         >::type typex;
00506     typex::invoke(ar, t);
00507 }
00508 
00509 #ifndef BOOST_NO_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ORDERING
00510 
00511 template<class T>
00512 struct check_tracking {
00513     typedef BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::if_<
00514         // if its never tracked.
00515         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME mpl::equal_to<
00516             serialization::tracking_level<T>,
00517             mpl::int_<serialization::track_never>
00518         >,
00519         // it better not be a pointer
00520         mpl::not_<is_pointer<T> >,
00521     //else
00522         // otherwise if it might be tracked.  So there shouldn't
00523         // be any problem making a const
00524         is_const<T>
00525     >::type typex;
00526     BOOST_STATIC_CONSTANT(bool, value = typex::value);
00527 };
00528 
00529 template<class Archive, class T>
00530 inline void save(Archive & ar, T &t){
00531     // if your program traps here, it indicates that your doing one of the following:
00532     // a) serializing an object of a type marked "track_never" through a pointer.
00533     // b) saving an non-const object of a type not markd "track_never)
00534     // Either of these conditions may be an indicator of an error usage of the
00535     // serialization library and should be double checked.  See documentation on
00536     // object tracking.  Also, see the "rationale" section of the documenation
00537     // for motivation for this checking.
00538     BOOST_STATIC_WARNING(check_tracking<T>::value);
00539         save(ar, const_cast<const T &>(t));
00540 }
00541 #endif
00542 
00543 } // namespace archive
00544 } // namespace boost
00545 
00546 #endif // BOOST_ARCHIVE_OSERIALIZER_HPP
